data.text: @Regina_Kanyu It's super popular! Changsha is soooooooo fun.
@gigicchang No, I have not got the opportunity to visit Changsha yet! I heard that it's very good!

@denniswu I usually order through WeChat when I leave the house, so by the time I get to the shop, it's ready, haha. A bubble milk tea is RMB 22. A good few kuai cheaper than the smallest latte in Starbucks. 

I've no idea about FX rates these days though...
@gigicchang But still … counting in RMB it’s more expensive than Taiwan or even HK equivalent. And the line is so long…
@gigicchang Hear, hear! I always let my beer warm up a little!
@chowspecial I'll keep a photo log and score sheet!

@kenbebelle I think I still prefer old school boba milk tea to fancy fruity fare, especially when I don't drink anything cold... (I'm a proper southerner and Chinese auntie on that front, haha. The only drink I'd consume cold is beer, but I'm an ale sort of person so I let it sit!)
@denniswu I only like the cheap ones (i.e. old school 珍珠奶茶, but they're sweeter than the used to be...)

@Regina_Kanyu When I was in Changsha in Jan, the first question I got asked was, have you had any 茶颜悦色 yet?!! 

I'm looking forward to more milk tea time in April. There's one just 5 mins walk from the hotel.
